alert.note: Alert for Bladen; Coastal Brunswick; Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Columbus; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 8:23PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of New Hanover, Pender, southeastern Bladen, Brunswick, eastern Columbus and southeastern Horry Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 821 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a broken line of strong showers and thunderstorms extending from 6 miles north of Rowan to near Lake Waccamaw to near Myrtle Beach Airport. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds 30 to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Myrtle Beach, North Myrtle Beach, Leland, Oak Island, Carolina Beach, Burgaw, Surfside Beach, Shallotte, Sunset Beach, Wrightsville Beach, Kure Beach, Surf City, Holden Beach, Ocean Isle Beach, Caswell Beach, Bald Head Island, Snows Cut, Little River Entrance, and South Masonboro Island. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 391 and 416. Interstate 140 between mile markers 15 and 20. US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 1 and 44. SC Highway 31 between mile markers 9 and 24. SC Highway 22 between mile markers 23 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bladen; Coastal Brunswick; Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Columbus; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender
